title: ASL 3.3 ‚Äî Compliments & Feedback üôå‚ú®
objectives: Give simple compliments (NICE, GOOD, COOL) and encouragement (PROUD, KEEP-GO, TRY)
Ask/answer for improvement using HOW? and HOW-IMPROVE? with clear WH-face
Offer specific, kind feedback with short action cues (PRACTICE, SLOW, AGAIN)

vocab.def: Positive reaction signs; short, clear acknowledgments.
A-hand traces up torso to chest; conveys encouragement.
Broad positive evaluative signs (use sparingly for emphasis).
Curved hand taps into open palm; repeat.
A-hand rubs across index finger; rehearsal/drill.
Dominant hand drags up back of non-dominant; reduce pace.
A-hand on flat palm moves upward; offer/ask help (directional).
Bent hands rotate out; WH-face for question form.
HOW + IMPROVE (hand moves to improve on palm); brows down.
Brows down for WH (HOW?); brows up for Y/N (YOU WANT HELP?).

sections.heading: Warm-Up: Praise & Pace

media.alt: NICE, GOOD, COOL, PROUD, TRY, AGAIN
media.caption: Mirror slowly with compact movements

sections.body: Drill **NICE, GOOD, COOL, PROUD, TRY, AGAIN**. Keep motions compact at torso; add a small nod for praise. Avoid exaggerated swings.

callouts.title: Ergonomics
callouts.body: Neutral wrist, relaxed shoulders; micro-break every 5‚Äì7 minutes.

callouts.title: Eye Gaze
callouts.body: Keep gaze on partner‚Äôs **face**; let feedback signs stay compact.

sections.heading: Model: Compliment ‚Üí Specific Note
sections.body:
Use a two-step frame:
1) Praise: **GOOD JOB. NICE. COOL.**
2) One concrete cue: **SLOW.** or **PRACTICE AGAIN.** or **HOLD MORE.**
Keep each clause 1‚Äì3 signs; pause slightly between praise and cue.
sections.teacherNote: Coach specificity (what to adjust) over general praise.

sections.heading: Questions: Ask for Help & Improvement
sections.body:
Frames:
‚Ä¢ **YOU WANT HELP?** (YES/NO face)
‚Ä¢ **HOW-IMPROVE?** (WH-face)
‚Ä¢ **WHAT PART HARD?** (WH-face)
Answers short: **YES, PLEASE.** **SLOW PLEASE.** **PRACTICE NUMBER 16‚Äì19.**

microCheck.q: Best follow-up after receiving a cue:
options: Repeat exactly once (AGAIN) at slower pace

sections.heading: Partner Practice: Glow + Grow
sections.body: A signs a short target (e.g., numbers 11‚Äì15 or WHAT-TIME?). B gives **one praise + one cue** (e.g., **GOOD. BROWS DOWN MORE.**). Switch roles; keep turns ‚âà20‚Äì30s.

microCheck.q: Which pair matches the Glow+Grow rule?

sections.teacherNote: Differentiate with prompt cards (numbers, time-first, color questions); seated options OK.

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **10‚Äì15s**: give a classmate **1 praise + 1 cue**, then ask **HOW?** or **HOW-IMPROVE?** and show them trying **AGAIN**.
sections.teacherNote: Offer privacy submission; caption should name the cue used (e.g., ‚ÄúWH-face stronger‚Äù).

items.q: Write a two-clause feedback gloss: praise + one cue for WHAT-TIME? (brows).

items.prompt: Which cue (SLOW, HOLD, BROWS) helps you most? What drill will you try next?

reflectionPrompt: Upload your 10‚Äì15s clip showing praise + cue + TRY AGAIN, with a caption naming the cue.
summary: You gave kind, specific feedback using praise-first framing, asked for help with HOW?/HOW-IMPROVE?, and practiced concise action cues.
